sentences.sContent: The government’s proposals were held up to ridicule (= suffered ridicule ) by opposition ministers.
sentences.sCn: 政府的提案遭到反对党部长们的嘲笑。

sentences.sContent: He had become an object of ridicule among the other teachers.
sentences.sCn: 他成了其他教师嘲笑的对象。

remMethod.val: rid(笑) + icule → 嘲笑， 奚落

trans.tranOther: unkind laughter or remarks that are intended to make someone or something seem stupid
to laugh at a person, idea etc and say that they are stupid
